review:
What seemed to be a unique and creative approach to light-puzzle themed game wound up getting a little too carried away with itself. Puzzles in later levels get so complex that it is practically impossible to come up with a plan; you simply have to try a few things and hope you're going in the right direction. "If its too hard, just use a guide." Yes, there are very helpful guides on this game, but that isn't the point of puzzles; the player should be able to figure it out themselves without feeling like they were using cheats or pure guesswork. It doesn't feel satisfying.

You might think "Its whatever, brute-forcing could be pretty fun" and i won't judge you, as maybe that's what you like about puzzle games, however that's where we get to the big kicker; in order to unlock the final level, you must complete every single level in the game in as few moves as possible. If you simply clear all the levels without doing this, you get absolutely nothing. No congrats, no achievement, no final level. The game simply expects you to go back and do the levels the "right" way. You can either do that, or quit with the game feeling incomplete (and missing one achievement).

review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

[b]Tl;dr:[/b] I expected a lot more from this game.

I was pretty familiar with its main mechanic, and I could easily get a grasp of the additional ones, but [b]I got more frustration than fun out of it.[/b]

Initial levels were as I expected. They were basic and fun while also teaching the core mechanics. Although this was the case, the [b]levels got pretty aimless as I progressed, they felt random.[/b] They were like a few levels put in one big level, which I hated since there is also an [b]aim of completing a level in less than a certain amount of moves[/b] in this game where [b]you don't know the amount.[/b] This was the most frustrating thing I've encountered in this game.

Another thing that I hated about this game is that you can't focus properly and progress in the game. [b]Every time you finish the game, the game takes you to the level selection menu where you need to select the next level to progress.[/b] I know that there are extra levels the player can explore in the level overview, but a linear progress that is not disrupted by constant "back to menu" sections would be great.

In short, I really wanted to like this game, but I ended up hating it. I basically [b]cannot recommend this game to anyone[/b] because of the design mistakes I presented above.

A Puzzle Wonderland: Navigating the Clever Conundrums of Wayout

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

Wayout offers players a minimalist and intellectually stimulating puzzle experience that challenges their logic and spatial reasoning. With its sleek visual design, innovative mechanics, and the allure of unraveling intricate puzzles, the game provides a satisfying and thought-provoking journey through a world of abstract challenges.

The visual design of Wayout is elegantly minimalistic, immersing players in a clean and uncluttered environment that places the focus squarely on the puzzles themselves. The use of color and design enhances the visual appeal without overwhelming the player.

At its core, Wayout is a puzzle-solving game where players must manipulate tiles to turn them all into the same color. The game's mechanics involve rotating and flipping tiles within a grid to achieve the desired color pattern, requiring careful planning and strategic thinking.

The puzzle design is a standout feature, as the game progressively introduces new mechanics and challenges that keep players engaged and mentally stimulated throughout the experience.

The game's simplicity and intuitive mechanics make it accessible to players of all skill levels, while the increasing complexity of the puzzles ensures that even experienced puzzle enthusiasts will find a satisfying challenge.

The sense of accomplishment from solving each puzzle is gratifying, and the game's progression offers a satisfying curve of difficulty.

However, the game's abstract nature and lack of narrative might not appeal to players seeking a more immersive or story-driven gaming experience. Wayout focuses primarily on the puzzle-solving aspect.

Some players might find certain puzzles to be quite challenging, potentially leading to moments of frustration.

In conclusion, Wayout offers an engaging and intellectually stimulating puzzle adventure that's perfect for players seeking a cerebral challenge. Its minimalist visuals, innovative mechanics, and the allure of unraveling intricate puzzles create an experience that's both satisfying and mentally rewarding. While its lack of narrative and abstract nature might not cater to all gaming preferences, those who appreciate the art of puzzle-solving and the thrill of overcoming brain-teasing challenges will find themselves immersed in the intriguing world of Wayout, where every tile turn is a step towards unraveling the mysteries of logic and spatial reasoning.

[h1] WAYOUT - ще одна доволі незвичайна головоломка від українських розробників! [/h1]
Доволі незвична для мене головоломка, яка доволі проста концептуально, але від того не менш захоплююча та цікава, як і інші ігри розробника. Я багато грав в ігри цього розробника, але таку гру точно не очікував побачити і це були приємні не очікування хд

[h1] Про гру: [/h1] [list]
[*] Візуал. У цього розробника класний стиль. Кожна гра має дуже приємний і насичений на кольори стиль. Так і тут, гра виглядає чудово!
[*] Геймплей. Концептуально і загалом гра доволі проста. Нам треба натискаючи на блоки, зробити так щоб усі вони стали білого кольору. І спочатку, це доволі просто… а потім коли тобі постійно додають нові і нові унікальні блоки, які комбінують перемикання кольорів треба дійсно ретельно подумати, щоб швидко закрити рівень. Мені сподобався такий геймплей, я не зустрічав схожих ігор і це було дійсно цікаво, хоча я розумію, що звучить це надто просто, щоб бути цікавим, але це не так.
[*] Контент. Стандартна ціна за гру 19 гривень і за це ви отримаєте 100 рівнів, дуже різноманітних рівнів.
[*] Є українська локалізація, що круто і приємно.
[*] Музика. У грі приємний, ніжний і доволі спокійний ембієнт(я вже повторююсь, але у кожній їх грі так). Мені сподобався такий музикальний супровід, він гарно доповнює відчуття спокою і чілу від візуалу)
[/list]

[h1] Висновки: [/h1]
Ось і відгук на останню на даний момент головоломку від Konstructors, невеликого розробника зі Львову, ігри якого розкрили для мене заново жанр головоломок. Усі ці ігри виділяються дуже приємним аудіо-візуалом та виверненим геймплеєм. Про цю гру скажу так. Мені видається, що вона набагато більш доступна ніж іншим, але доволі цікава, тому я б порекомендував би спробувати цю гру усім любителям головоломок та чілу. Коштує вона не дорого, але дає доволі багато приємно проведеного часу. Гарної вам гри :З

[b]My Playtime:[/b] 4.7h (100% achievement, finished the game)
[b]Grindy Achievement(s):[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement(s):[/b] Yes (40 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement(s):[/b] No.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[b]Wayout[/b] is a minimalistic puzzle game where you have to change all colors in the level to white. It offers 130 levels in total, including both main and optional levels.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- 130 levels with different mechanics
- Relaxing music
- You're allowed to choose any levels that you want to advance to the next section

[b]Cons:[/b]
- No hint and undo button

[b]Specs[/b]
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you like simplistic puzzle games, buy this game.[/i]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h3]Visuals[/h3]
[b]Wayout[/b] was displayed in simplistic visuals. Level selection is made in a way that resembles the main game with several tiles with different heights based on your progress. That being said, it's still easy to navigate and understand how they work even for first-timers.

[h3]The Game[/h3]
[b]Gameplay[/b]
Just like other simplistic puzzle games out there, [b]Wayout[/b] doesn't try to explain its mechanics with text. You are supposed to learn how it works by completing the first few easy levels. Several tiles will be displayed in a certain format on each level, and you are supposed to turn all tiles to white. Flipping one tile will turn that tile and its adjacent ones into a different color (white to red, red to white), forcing you to flip it in the correct position, and sometimes, order.

Different mechanics will be offered in every 20 levels. The basic gameplay will still be the same, although the new mechanic will slightly change it. However, I had issues in understanding the third mechanic - it can be hard to fathom how the flipping works unless you think it out properly.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=808900815

[b]Length and Difficulty[/b]
I finished the game, including all of the bonus levels in 4.7h. Achievement hunters don't need to perfect all levels to get 100%, although there are some guides available if you want to aim for it. That being said, the game can be challenging at some point; I even have to resort to using the guide sometimes, both for perfecting all levels and finishing some levels that I was stuck on. I couldn't seem to find the right formula to finish all levels without brute-forcing it, so that's what I did to finish the levels, especially those that I got stuck on.

That being said, I still had fun finishing the game. The new mechanics help to make the game not repetitive, and it helps to refresh your mind from the more difficult levels since it will always start with the easy ones to let you know how it works. It will take a while before it starts ramping up the difficulty, which will always happen at the end of the sections.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[b]Wayout[/b] manages to provide challenging puzzles from its simple mechanics, providing its players with numerous levels with varying difficulty. It's perfect for those who want to use their wits without having to spend too much time. Each level can be finished in several minutes, and it won't take long before you finish everything.

review:
Ah, meu amigo(a), prepara a pipoca e se ajeita na cadeira, porque o jogo WayOut veio para revolucionar o conceito do bom e velho Lights Out! Sabe aquele joguinho de apagar luzes que a gente brincava quando era criança? Esquece! WayOut vai além disso e te traz uma variedade de níveis e mecânicas que vão te deixar de queixo caído!
A proposta é simples: cada nível tem o mesmo objetivo - apagar todas as peças, mas com o menor número de movimentos possível. Acredita que dá até para testar os limites do seu cérebro? É, meu amigo, você vai ficar quebrando a cuca para aperfeiçoar cada quebra-cabeça. É o desafio na medida certa para deixar a sua mente afiada!
E o melhor de tudo é que essa jornada é pra lá de relaxante, quase que uma meditação jogável! O jogo segue a filosofia Zen e tem uma interface minimalista, sem contadores de tempo ou pontuação. Nada de distrações, é só você e o quebra-cabeça, mano! Essa vibe tranquila te permite se concentrar e se perder em cada desafio.

E não pense que o jogo fica na mesmice, não! Ele traz uma combinação de mecânicas clássicas do Lights Out com um toque de novidade, que vai te manter colado na tela por horas a fio! E falando em horas, são mais de 100 níveis artesanalmente criados para você se deliciar.

Tem mais! O jogo é dividido em seis capítulos, cada um com uma paleta de cores e uma experiência de gameplay próprias. Ou seja, é uma viagem completa por mundos diferentes, tudo isso envolvido por um estilo gráfico único e trilhas sonoras ambientes que vão te fazer suspirar de tão bonito!
Em resumo, WayOut é a diversão garantida, uma aventura relaxante e desafiadora que vai conquistar o seu coração. Se você está procurando um jogo para exercitar a mente sem stress, sem dúvida, é a escolha certa! Então, meu amigo, prepare-se para embarcar nessa jornada de pura diversão cerebral e deixar a sua mente ser o seu guia!

Like are you kidding, okay if you give a extra achievement for that insane stuff but to lock a level behind something you either need a omega brain for or watch a youtube video for is ridiculous. I would have rated this game a 8,5 if that wouldn't be the case. However now I would say it's a 6 I guess I can recommend the game just don't loose your sanity over the insane challenge of doing everything with the limited amount of moves. This challenge is just not fun at all. I felt like people should know this stuff so decide for yourself if the game is worth it or not?

Edit: Aparently to actually beat the game you have to do all of this insane stuff (Get all levels with perfect moves so make no mistakes). And that is why I just can't recommend it. Honestly when I think about it deeply that stuff gets me a bit mad. And it ruined my experience completely So yeah.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281298850', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1665258770}
review:
Wayout est un petit jeu de puzzle minimaliste développé par le studio indépendant Jukka Seppänen. Le jeu consiste à faire pivoter des disques de couleur pour correspondre à un modèle donné, en utilisant un nombre limité de mouvements.

Le jeu est simple mais addictif, et la difficulté augmente au fur et à mesure que le joueur progresse dans les niveaux. Les graphismes sont très minimalistes, mais cela ajoute à l'atmosphère relaxante du jeu. La bande-son est également très relaxante et contribue à l'ambiance générale.

Le gameplay est très bien conçu, avec une difficulté croissante qui permet aux joueurs de se sentir progresser au fur et à mesure qu'ils avancent dans les niveaux. Les contrôles sont faciles à comprendre et à utiliser, ce qui rend le jeu accessible aux joueurs de tous niveaux de compétence.

En fin de compte, si vous cherchez un jeu de puzzle relaxant et minimaliste, je vous recommande vivement Wayout. Le jeu est simple mais addictif, et offre une expérience de jeu détendue et agréable. Cependant, si vous recherchez un jeu avec une histoire complexe ou une action intense, ce jeu pourrait ne pas être pour vous.

review:
解密益智游戏 只要你喜欢益智小游戏 我第一个推荐就是Wayout系列 总游玩时长8-20小时
我很久之前就有玩过 它的原型是Lights Out 一款由Tiger Electronics发行的“掌上游戏机”
5*5的灯阵 总共有8388608个不同谜题 保证每次玩的都不一样
交换性体现在哪 按灯的先后顺序不会影响最后的结果 所以问题归结于“按哪些灯”而不是“如何操作”
可惜这部作品的评测不是很多 还是好多玩家没有体验过这款游戏
要是真的很感兴趣 也可以考虑打折的时候3r左右入手~

review:
游戏机制乍一看十分有创意, 但实际上游玩体验却十分差劲, 
建立在这种机制上的关卡设计可以说是几乎没有, 给人的体验就像是随意把一个魔方拧乱了给别人还原, 作者根本不需要进行过多的设计, 反正拧乱就行了, 而玩家则是连套公式都不太会, 只能不断试错. 
除了每章刚开始的几关, 其他的基本上都需要靠穷举和试错来得出, 尤其是那些没有功能键引导的关, 以及类似倒数第二关那么大的题板, 十分之恶心人.  
我宁愿推荐Acromatic也不推荐这个

The game design is a piece of crap, and you can only figure it out by trying out all of the posibilities.
I would recommend Acromatic rather than this.

review: "Wayout" to prosta, ale zabawna gra logiczna, w której gracz musi obrócić kafelki, aby ułożyć drogę dla postaci z punktu startowego do celu.Gra oferuje minimalistyczną grafikę i spokojną, kojącą muzykę, co sprawia, że rozgrywka jest relaksująca i pozwala na skupienie się na rozwiązywaniu zagadek.Kontrolowanie gry jest bardzo łatwe i intuicyjne, a poziomy są różnorodne i wymagające. review:
𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞:

Today we have a rather pleasant and interesting puzzle in front of us. It seems that Wayout requires the same thing everywhere – to poke at certain keys in order to turn the entire available keyboard into the right color, but it always finds a place for diversity.

The gameplay is quite easy, we just have to click on the cubes until all of them on the field are closed. At the same time, the player is limited by the number of moves for an ideal passage.

The game has 6 chapters, each of which slightly changes the gameplay, 20 levels in each. All cubes, when you click on them, affect others as well. This is where the main game changes are tied, in one chapter the keys are affected diagonally, in the other, for example, the rest along the perimeter.

Naturally, in the best way, we need to disable all tiles by making the minimum possible number of moves. If you want to perform perfectly, then you need to meet a certain amount.

I can't help but note the gradually increasing complexity of the levels. The game at the beginning and the last levels feel completely different. The game is ready to challenge and, despite the relaxing atmosphere, make you think carefully.

I can boast that I passed the game completely by myself.💪🏻
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2932799183

The game relaxes quite well, because everything predisposes to this: a pleasant and interesting gameplay, relaxing music, a minimalistic and intuitive interface. It can also cause difficulties and throw up a challenge in solving puzzles, because not all of them are simple. I definitely recommend it for purchase.

review:
Starts simple enough, then you feel like on Maths class after you've skipped couple of lessons, except nobody is going to explain you anything, because there's no tutorials. Every time game introduces new mechanic you get to click on 1-2 buttons, which supposed to explain you how it works, except you have no clue how it's gonna synergize with other mechanics till you figure it out by randomly clicking bunch of times. Makes you go on clicking rampage, then to give up and go look up a guide.
Cannot restart puzzle that you get after completing Section 6 other than by restarting the game which is not most comfortable way to do so (while puzzles that were part of the sets had reset button).
Game also doesn't show you in how many turns you're supposed to solve each puzzle, instead it shows you white button that turns red every time you went above minimum turns.
Note that a lot of positive reviews that game has because of "easy card farm". Achievements (look like letters and numbers) from it also can be used to customise your profile page, but that's about it.

review:
Это закончилось и я рад. Прошёл не без помощи подсказок, к своему сожалению.
Ненавижу такие игры, в которых чтобы пройти уровень и получить доступ ко всему контенту, нужно сделать 20-70 кликов безошибочно. Что нихера не очевидно. То есть это действительно головоломка, в который ты не видишь решения, сколько бы ты не ломал голову. Нужно наощупь пробовать, нажимать, рестартить. И так, возможно, часы, пока ты не найдёшь решение к одному уровню среднего масштаба. А их сотня!
И что больше всего раздражает — у тебя нет права на ошибку. Мисскликнул — нажимай рестарт, запоминай 20 последовательных действий, чтобы снова случайно не туда нажать.
Почему нет возможности откатить время на одно действие назад? Это же не поменяло бы игру идейно. Но было бы удобно для пользователя.
Неоправданно сложно. Некомфортный игровой экспириенс.
